p: The most frequent inflammatory arthritis in the world is gout. It is characterized by prevalence higher than 1% in the occidental countries, especially in Europe and North America [ 1]. Actually, recent works suggest that men have a higher prevalence and incidence of gout than women [ 1, 4]. Indeed, it is necessary to take this disease seriously because it is associated with various health complications as cardiovascular risk, hypertension, chronic kidney disorder, obesity, and metabolic syndrome [ 5â€“ 7].
